intro: Axanthes strigosa, commonly known as the hairy axanthes, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid regions. The plant is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in umbels. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its common name. Axanthes strigosa is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
